page.title: 05CHURCHES:CHURCH OF SCOTLAND
page.content: Both villages have a church, both Church of Scotland. The churches tend to reflect the nature of the countryside and its inhabitants- traditional and conservative- and both face slowly dwindling congregations. Both parishes are linked charges, i.e. the ministers at each are responsible for more than one church. Within the past two years, the Hillocks Church, linked with Newbigging Church, was closed because the shrinking congregation no longer justified its existence. Also within the past two years, the Churches at Newbigging and Monikie, served by the same minister, have been reduced to one weekly service in rotation for a trial period. At the end of this trial period, if the numbers continue to decline, the Church of Scotland will insiston the closure of one church.
